00059 /* Use with ShowDeprecationWarning macro */
00060 typedef struct {
00061     bool warn_done;
00062     void *link;
00063 } WarnLink;
00064 
00065 #define ShowDeprecationWarning(old_way, new_way)                              \
00066 {                                                                             \
00067     static WarnLink wlink = {false, NULL};                                    \
00068     if ((m_ignore_deprecation_warnings || wlink.warn_done)==0)                \
00069     {                                                                         \
00070         ShowDeprecationWarning_func(old_way, new_way);                        \
00071                                                                               \
00072         WarnLink *wlink_last= GetDeprecationWarningLinkLast();                \
00073         wlink.warn_done = true;                                               \
00074         wlink.link = NULL;                                                    \
00075                                                                               \
00076         if(wlink_last) {                                                      \
00077             wlink_last->link= (void *)&(wlink);                               \
00078             SetDeprecationWarningLinkLast(&(wlink));                          \
00079         }                                                                     \
00080         else {                                                                \
00081             SetDeprecationWarningFirst(&(wlink));                             \
00082             SetDeprecationWarningLinkLast(&(wlink));                          \
00083         }                                                                     \
00084     }                                                                         \
00085 }                                                                             \
00086

00089 typedef struct PyObjectPlus_Proxy {
00090     PyObject_HEAD       /* required python macro   */
00091     class PyObjectPlus *ref;    // pointer to GE object, it holds a reference to this proxy
00092     void *ptr;                  // optional pointer to generic structure, the structure holds no reference to this proxy
00093     bool py_owns;       // true if the object pointed by ref should be deleted when the proxy is deleted
00094     bool py_ref;        // true if proxy is connected to a GE object (ref is used)
00095 #ifdef USE_WEAKREFS
00096     PyObject *in_weakreflist; // weak reference enabler
00097 #endif
00098 } PyObjectPlus_Proxy;
00099 
00100 #define BGE_PROXY_ERROR_MSG "Blender Game Engine data has been freed, cannot use this python variable"
00101 #define BGE_PROXY_REF(_self) (((PyObjectPlus_Proxy *)_self)->ref)
00102 #define BGE_PROXY_PTR(_self) (((PyObjectPlus_Proxy *)_self)->ptr)
00103 #define BGE_PROXY_PYOWNS(_self) (((PyObjectPlus_Proxy *)_self)->py_owns)
00104 #define BGE_PROXY_PYREF(_self) (((PyObjectPlus_Proxy *)_self)->py_ref)
00105 #ifdef USE_WEAKREFS
00106 #  define BGE_PROXY_WKREF(_self) (((PyObjectPlus_Proxy *)_self)->in_weakreflist)
00107 #endif
00108 
00109 /* Note, sometimes we don't care what BGE type this is as long as its a proxy */
00110 #define BGE_PROXY_CHECK_TYPE(_type) ((_type)->tp_dealloc == PyObjectPlus::py_base_dealloc)
00111 
00112 /* Opposite of BGE_PROXY_REF */
00113 #define BGE_PROXY_FROM_REF(_self) (((PyObjectPlus *)_self)->GetProxy())
00114 
00115 
00116 // This must be the first line of each 
00117 // PyC++ class
00118 // AttributesPtr correspond to attributes of proxy generic pointer 
00119 // each PyC++ class must be registered in KX_PythonInitTypes.cpp
00120 #define __Py_Header                                                           \
00121 public:                                                                       \
00122     static PyTypeObject   Type;                                               \
00123     static PyMethodDef    Methods[];                                          \
00124     static PyAttributeDef Attributes[];                                       \
00125     virtual PyTypeObject *GetType(void) {                                     \
00126         return &Type;                                                         \
00127     }                                                                         \
00128     virtual PyObject *GetProxy() {                                            \
00129         return GetProxyPlus_Ext(this, &Type, NULL);                           \
00130     }                                                                         \
00131     virtual PyObject *NewProxy(bool py_owns) {                                \
00132         return NewProxyPlus_Ext(this, &Type, NULL, py_owns);                  \
00133     }                                                                         \
00134 
00135 // leave above line empty (macro)!
00136 // use this macro for class that use generic pointer in proxy
00137 // GetProxy() and NewProxy() must be defined to set the correct pointer in the proxy
00138 #define __Py_HeaderPtr                                                        \
00139 public:                                                                       \
00140     static PyTypeObject   Type;                                               \
00141     static PyMethodDef    Methods[];                                          \
00142     static PyAttributeDef Attributes[];                                       \
00143     static PyAttributeDef AttributesPtr[];                                    \
00144     virtual PyTypeObject *GetType(void) {                                     \
00145         return &Type;                                                         \
00146     }                                                                         \
00147     virtual PyObject *GetProxy();                                             \
00148     virtual PyObject *NewProxy(bool py_owns);                                 \
00149 
00150 // leave above line empty (macro)!
00151 #ifdef WITH_CXX_GUARDEDALLOC
00152 #define Py_Header __Py_Header                                                 \
00153     void *operator new(size_t num_bytes) {                                    \
00154         return MEM_mallocN(num_bytes, Type.tp_name);                          \
00155     }                                                                         \
00156     void operator delete(void *mem) {                                         \
00157         MEM_freeN(mem);                                                       \
00158     }                                                                         \
00159 
00160 #else
00161 #  define Py_Header __Py_Header
00162 #endif
00163 
00164 #ifdef WITH_CXX_GUARDEDALLOC
00165 #define Py_HeaderPtr __Py_HeaderPtr                                           \
00166     void *operator new(size_t num_bytes) {                                    \
00167         return MEM_mallocN(num_bytes, Type.tp_name);                          \
00168     }                                                                         \
00169     void operator delete( void *mem ) {                                       \
00170         MEM_freeN(mem);                                                       \
00171     }                                                                         \
00172 
00173 #else
00174 #  define Py_HeaderPtr __Py_HeaderPtr
00175 #endif

00180  * was because the attribute didnt exits of if there was some problem setting the value

00185 #define PY_SET_ATTR_MISSING     -1
00186 #define PY_SET_ATTR_SUCCESS      0

00192 #define KX_PYMETHOD(class_name, method_name)                                   \
00193     PyObject* Py##method_name(PyObject* args, PyObject* kwds);                 \
00194     static PyObject*                                                           \
00195     sPy##method_name(PyObject* self, PyObject* args, PyObject* kwds) {         \
00196         if(BGE_PROXY_REF(self)==NULL) {                                        \
00197             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,                                \
00198                             #class_name "." #method_name "() - "               \
00199                             BGE_PROXY_ERROR_MSG);                              \
00200             return NULL;                                                       \
00201         }                                                                      \
00202         return((class_name*)BGE_PROXY_REF(self))->Py##method_name(args, kwds); \
00203     }                                                                          \
00204 
00205 #define KX_PYMETHOD_VARARGS(class_name, method_name)                           \
00206     PyObject* Py##method_name(PyObject* args);                                 \
00207     static PyObject*                                                           \
00208     sPy##method_name(PyObject* self, PyObject* args) {                         \
00209         if(BGE_PROXY_REF(self)==NULL) {                                        \
00210             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,                                \
00211                             #class_name "." #method_name "() - "               \
00212                             BGE_PROXY_ERROR_MSG); return NULL;                 \
00213         }                                                                      \
00214         return((class_name*)BGE_PROXY_REF(self))->Py##method_name(args);       \
00215     }                                                                          \
00216 
00217 #define KX_PYMETHOD_NOARGS(class_name, method_name)                            \
00218     PyObject* Py##method_name();                                               \
00219     static PyObject*                                                           \
00220     sPy##method_name(PyObject* self) {                                         \
00221         if(BGE_PROXY_REF(self)==NULL) {                                        \
00222             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,                                \
00223                             #class_name "." #method_name "() - "               \
00224                             BGE_PROXY_ERROR_MSG); return NULL;                 \
00225         }                                                                      \
00226         return((class_name*)BGE_PROXY_REF(self))->Py##method_name();           \
00227     }                                                                          \
00228 
00229 #define KX_PYMETHOD_O(class_name, method_name)                                 \
00230     PyObject* Py##method_name(PyObject* value);                                \
00231     static PyObject*                                                           \
00232     sPy##method_name(PyObject* self, PyObject* value) {                        \
00233         if(BGE_PROXY_REF(self)==NULL) {                                        \
00234             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,                                \
00235                             #class_name "." #method_name "(value) - "          \
00236                             BGE_PROXY_ERROR_MSG); return NULL;                 \
00237         }                                                                      \
00238         return((class_name*)BGE_PROXY_REF(self))->Py##method_name(value);      \
00239     }                                                                          \
00240 
00241 #define KX_PYMETHOD_DOC(class_name, method_name)                               \
00242     PyObject* Py##method_name(PyObject* args, PyObject* kwds);                 \
00243     static PyObject*                                                           \
00244     sPy##method_name(PyObject* self, PyObject* args, PyObject* kwds) {         \
00245         if(BGE_PROXY_REF(self)==NULL) {                                        \
00246             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,                                \
00247                             #class_name "." #method_name "(...) - "            \
00248                             BGE_PROXY_ERROR_MSG); return NULL;                 \
00249         }                                                                      \
00250         return((class_name*)BGE_PROXY_REF(self))->Py##method_name(args, kwds); \
00251     }                                                                          \
00252     static const char method_name##_doc[];                                     \
00253 
00254 #define KX_PYMETHOD_DOC_VARARGS(class_name, method_name)                       \
00255     PyObject* Py##method_name(PyObject* args);                                 \
00256     static PyObject*                                                           \
00257     sPy##method_name(PyObject* self, PyObject* args) {                         \
00258         if(BGE_PROXY_REF(self)==NULL) {                                        \
00259             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,                                \
00260                             #class_name "." #method_name "(...) - "            \
00261                             BGE_PROXY_ERROR_MSG);                              \
00262             return NULL;                                                       \
00263         }                                                                      \
00264         return((class_name*)BGE_PROXY_REF(self))->Py##method_name(args);       \
00265     }                                                                          \
00266     static const char method_name##_doc[];                                     \
00267

00270     static PyObject*                                                           \
00271     sPy##method_name(PyObject* self, PyObject* value) {                        \
00272         if(BGE_PROXY_REF(self)==NULL) {                                        \
00273             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,                                \

00279     }                                                                          \

00297 /* The line above should remain empty */
00301 #define KX_PYMETHODTABLE(class_name, method_name) \
00302     {#method_name , (PyCFunction) class_name::sPy##method_name, METH_VARARGS, (const char *)class_name::method_name##_doc}
00303 
00304 #define KX_PYMETHODTABLE_O(class_name, method_name) \
00305     {#method_name , (PyCFunction) class_name::sPy##method_name, METH_O, (const char *)class_name::method_name##_doc}
00306 
00307 #define KX_PYMETHODTABLE_NOARGS(class_name, method_name) \
00308     {#method_name , (PyCFunction) class_name::sPy##method_name, METH_NOARGS, (const char *)class_name::method_name##_doc}
00309 
00310 #define KX_PYMETHODTABLE_KEYWORDS(class_name, method_name) \
00311     {#method_name , (PyCFunction) class_name::sPy##method_name, METH_VARARGS|METH_KEYWORDS, (const char *)class_name::method_name##_doc}
00312 
00316 #define KX_PYMETHODDEF_DOC(class_name, method_name, doc_string) \
00317 const char class_name::method_name##_doc[] = doc_string; \
00318 PyObject* class_name::Py##method_name(PyObject* args, PyObject* kwds)
00319 
00320 #define KX_PYMETHODDEF_DOC_VARARGS(class_name, method_name, doc_string) \
00321 const char class_name::method_name##_doc[] = doc_string; \
00322 PyObject* class_name::Py##method_name(PyObject* args)
00323 
00324 #define KX_PYMETHODDEF_DOC_O(class_name, method_name, doc_string) \
00325 const char class_name::method_name##_doc[] = doc_string; \
00326 PyObject* class_name::Py##method_name(PyObject* value)
00327 
00328 #define KX_PYMETHODDEF_DOC_NOARGS(class_name, method_name, doc_string) \
00329 const char class_name::method_name##_doc[] = doc_string; \
00330 PyObject* class_name::Py##method_name()

00335 enum KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE {
00336     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOL,
00337     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_ENUM,
00338     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_SHORT,
00339     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_INT,
00340     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_FLOAT,
00341     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING,
00342     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_DUMMY,
00343     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_FUNCTION,
00344     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_VECTOR,
00345     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_FLAG,
00346     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_CHAR
00347 };
00348 
00349 enum KX_PYATTRIBUTE_ACCESS {
00350     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RW,
00351     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RO
00352 };
00353 
00354 struct KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF;
00355 typedef int (*KX_PYATTRIBUTE_CHECK_FUNCTION)(void *self, const struct KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef);
00356 typedef int (*KX_PYATTRIBUTE_SET_FUNCTION)(void *self, const struct KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef, PyObject *value);
00357 typedef PyObject* (*KX_PYATTRIBUTE_GET_FUNCTION)(void *self, const struct KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef);
00358 
00359 typedef struct KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF {
00360     const char *m_name;             // name of the python attribute
00361     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE m_type;     // type of value
00362     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_ACCESS m_access; // read/write access or read-only
00363     int m_imin;                     // minimum value in case of integer attributes 
00364                                     // (for string: minimum string length, for flag: mask value, for float: matrix row size)
00365     int m_imax;                     // maximum value in case of integer attributes 
00366                                     // (for string: maximum string length, for flag: 1 if flag is negative, float: vector/matrix col size)
00367     float m_fmin;                   // minimum value in case of float attributes
00368     float m_fmax;                   // maximum value in case of float attributes
00369     bool   m_clamp;                 // enforce min/max value by clamping
00370     bool   m_usePtr;                // the attribute uses the proxy generic pointer, set at runtime
00371     size_t m_offset;                // position of field in structure
00372     size_t m_size;                  // size of field for runtime verification (enum only)
00373     size_t m_length;                // length of array, 1=simple attribute
00374     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_CHECK_FUNCTION m_checkFunction;  // static function to check the assignment, returns 0 if no error
00375     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_SET_FUNCTION m_setFunction;  // static function to check the assignment, returns 0 if no error
00376     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_GET_FUNCTION m_getFunction;  // static function to check the assignment, returns 0 if no error
00377 
00378     // The following pointers are just used to have compile time check for attribute type.
00379     // It would have been good to use a union but that would require C99 compatibility
00380     // to initialize specific union fields through designated initializers.
00381     struct {
00382         bool *m_boolPtr;
00383         short int *m_shortPtr;
00384         int *m_intPtr;
00385         float *m_floatPtr;
00386         STR_String *m_stringPtr;
00387         MT_Vector3 *m_vectorPtr;
00388         char *m_charPtr;
00389     } m_typeCheck;
00390 } PyAttributeDef;
00391 
00392 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_BOOL_RW(name,object,field) \
00393     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOL, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RW, 0, 1, 0.f, 0.f, false, false, offsetof(object,field), 0, 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, {&((object *)0)->field, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }
00394 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_BOOL_RW_CHECK(name,object,field,function) \
00395     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOL, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RW, 0, 1, 0.f, 0.f, false, false, offsetof(object,field), 0, 1, &object::function, NULL, NULL, {&((object *)0)->field, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }
00396 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_BOOL_RO(name,object,field) \
00397     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOL, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RO, 0, 1, 0.f, 0.f, false, false, offsetof(object,field), 0, 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, {&((object *)0)->field, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }
00398 
00399 /* attribute points to a single bit of an integer field, attribute=true if bit is set */
00400 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_FLAG_RW(name,object,field,bit) \
00401     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_FLAG, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RW, bit, 0, 0.f, 0.f, false, false, offsetof(object,field), sizeof(((object *)0)->field), 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }
00402 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_FLAG_RW_CHECK(name,object,field,bit,function) \
00403     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_FLAG, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RW, bit, 0, 0.f, 0.f, false, false, offsetof(object,field), sizeof(((object *)0)->field), 1, &object::function, NULL, NULL, {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }
00404 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_FLAG_RO(name,object,field,bit) \
00405     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_FLAG, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RO, bit, 0, 0.f, 0.f, false, false, offsetof(object,field), sizeof(((object *)0)->field), 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }
00406

00415 // enum field cannot be mapped to pointer (because we would need a pointer for each enum)
00416 // use field size to verify mapping at runtime only, assuming enum size is equal to int size.
00417 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_ENUM_RW(name,min,max,clamp,object,field) \
00418     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_ENUM, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RW, min, max, 0.f, 0.f, clamp, false, offsetof(object,field), sizeof(((object *)0)->field), 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }
00419 #define KX_PYATTRIBUTE_ENUM_RW_CHECK(name,min,max,clamp,object,field,function) \
00420     { name, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_TYPE_ENUM, KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RW, min, max, 0.f, 0.f, clamp, false, offsetof(object,field), sizeof(((object *)0)->field), 1, &object::function, NULL, NULL, {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL} }

00528  * PyObjectPlus
00529 ------------------------------*/
00530 typedef PyTypeObject * PyParentObject;              // Define the PyParent Object
00531 
00532 #else // WITH_PYTHON
00533 
00534 #ifdef WITH_CXX_GUARDEDALLOC
00535 #define Py_Header                                                             \
00536 public:                                                                       \
00537     void *operator new(size_t num_bytes) {                                    \
00538         return MEM_mallocN(num_bytes, "GE:PyObjectPlus");                     \
00539     }                                                                         \
00540     void operator delete( void *mem ) {                                       \
00541         MEM_freeN(mem);                                                       \
00542     }                                                                         \
00543 
00544 #define Py_HeaderPtr                                                          \
00545 public:                                                                       \
00546     void *operator new(size_t num_bytes) {                                    \
00547         return MEM_mallocN(num_bytes, "GE:PyObjectPlusPtr");                  \
00548     }                                                                         \
00549     void operator delete( void *mem ) {                                       \
00550     MEM_freeN(mem);                                                           \
00551     }                                                                         \
00552 
00553 #else // WITH_CXX_GUARDEDALLOC
00554 
00555 #define Py_Header \
00556 public: \
00557 
00558 #define Py_HeaderPtr \
00559 public: \
00560 
00561 #endif // WITH_CXX_GUARDEDALLOC
00562 
00563 #endif
00564 
00565 
00566 // By making SG_QList the ultimate parent for PyObjectPlus objects, it
00567 // allows to put them in 2 different dynamic lists at the same time
00568 // The use of these links is interesting because they free of memory allocation
00569 // but it's very important not to mess up with them. If you decide that 
00570 // the SG_QList or SG_DList component is used for something for a certain class,
00571 // they cannot can be used for anything else at a parent level!
00572 // What these lists are and what they are used for must be carefully documented
00573 // at the level where they are used.
00574 // DON'T MAKE ANY USE OF THESE LIST AT THIS LEVEL, they are already used
00575 // at SCA_IActuator, SCA_ISensor, SCA_IController level which rules out the
00576 // possibility to use them at SCA_ILogicBrick, CValue and PyObjectPlus level.
00577 class PyObjectPlus : public SG_QList
00578 {               // The PyObjectPlus abstract class
00579     Py_Header                           // Always start with Py_Header
00580     
00581 public:
00582     PyObjectPlus();
00583     
00584     virtual ~PyObjectPlus();                    // destructor
00585     
00586 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00587     PyObject *m_proxy; /* actually a PyObjectPlus_Proxy */
00588 
00589     /* These static functions are referenced by ALL PyObjectPlus_Proxy types
00590      * they take the C++ reference from the PyObjectPlus_Proxy and call
00591      * its own virtual py_repr, py_base_dealloc ,etc. functions.
00592      */
00593 
00594     static PyObject*        py_base_new(PyTypeObject *type, PyObject *args, PyObject *kwds); /* allows subclassing */
00595     static void         py_base_dealloc(PyObject *self);
00596     static PyObject*        py_base_repr(PyObject *self);
00597 
00598     /* These are all virtual python methods that are defined in each class
00599      * Our own fake subclassing calls these on each class, then calls the parent */
00600     virtual PyObject*       py_repr(void);
00601     /* subclass may overwrite this function to implement more sophisticated method of validating a proxy */
00602     virtual bool            py_is_valid(void) { return true; }
00603 
00604     static PyObject*        py_get_attrdef(PyObject *self_py, const PyAttributeDef *attrdef);
00605     static int              py_set_attrdef(PyObject *self_py, PyObject *value, const PyAttributeDef *attrdef);
00606     
00607     /* Kindof dumb, always returns True, the false case is checked for, before this function gets accessed */
00608     static PyObject*    pyattr_get_invalid(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef);
00609 
00610     static PyObject *GetProxyPlus_Ext(PyObjectPlus *self, PyTypeObject *tp, void *ptr);
00611     /* self=NULL => proxy to generic pointer detached from GE object
00612      *              if py_owns is true, the memory pointed by ptr will be deleted automatically with MEM_freeN
00613      * self!=NULL=> proxy attached to GE object, ptr is optional and point to a struct from which attributes can be defined
00614      *              if py_owns is true, the object will be deleted automatically, ptr will NOT be deleted
00615      *              (assume object destructor takes care of it) */
00616     static PyObject *NewProxyPlus_Ext(PyObjectPlus *self, PyTypeObject *tp, void *ptr, bool py_owns);
00617 
00618     static  WarnLink*       GetDeprecationWarningLinkFirst(void);
00619     static  WarnLink*       GetDeprecationWarningLinkLast(void);
00620     static  void            SetDeprecationWarningFirst(WarnLink* wlink);
00621     static  void            SetDeprecationWarningLinkLast(WarnLink* wlink);
00622     static void         NullDeprecationWarning();
00623     
00625     static void         SetDeprecationWarnings(bool ignoreDeprecationWarnings);
00627     static void         ShowDeprecationWarning_func(const char* method,const char* prop);
00628     static void         ClearDeprecationWarning();
00629     
00630 #endif
00631 
00632     void    InvalidateProxy();
00633 
00637     virtual void ProcessReplica();
00638 
00639     static bool         m_ignore_deprecation_warnings;
00640 };

00643 PyObject *PyUnicode_From_STR_String(const STR_String& str);
00644 #endif
